snippet: When the S.E.C. announced it was awarding $400,000 to a whistle-blower, it didn’t name the recipient per the Dodd-Frank law. His name is Bill Lloyd, and this is his story.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column relates story of Bill Lloyd, whistle-blower who received $400,000 from the Securities and Exchange Commission for exposing financial fraud at MassMutual Financial Group; praises Lloyd for his principled courage, noting that his actions saved investors from enormous losses; holds case shows that whistle-blower provisions of the Dodd-Frank law are working as intended.
lead_paragraph: When the S.E.C. announced it was awarding $400,000 to a whistle-blower, it didn’t name the recipient per the Dodd-Frank law. His name is Bill Lloyd, and this is his story.
